children.name: to put information or a program into a computer
put sth in/into u
children.definition: put something in/into/ˌpʊt (sth) ˈɪn, ˈɪntuː/
examples: nhập cái gì vào
▪ we put all these details into our computer, and it chooses a suitable partner for you.
▪ the quality of output data will depend on the data you have put in.

children.name: enter b1
children.definition: enter/ˈentəʳ/  to put information into a computer by pressing the keys:
examples: nhập
▪ enter the amount of money you wish to take out of your account.
▪ if a word is entered incorrectly the machine refuses to obey the command.
enterverbinformation ghinhập
[ t ] to put information into a computer, book or document
_you have to enter apasswordto access the database.

children.name: input x
children.definition: input/ˈɪnpʊt/  to put information into a computer:
examples: nhập liệu
▪ the user inputs the data, and the computer stores it in its memory.
▪ we’re currently inputting the names and addresses of all our customers into a database.
inputverb[ t ]inputting,inputtedorinput,đưa (dữ liệu) vào máy tính
to put information into a computer or other piece of electronic equipment
_i've spent the morning inputting dataintothe computer.

children.name: load b2
children.definition: load/ləʊd/  to put a program into a computer so that it is ready to be used:
examples: tải
▪ load is a command which loads a new program from the file.load into
▪ the program can be encoded on the disk’s surface and then loaded into the microprocessor.

children.name: input b2
children.definition: inputnoun sự nhập liệu
examples: [ c or u ] something such as energy, money or information that is put into a system,
organization or machine so that it can operate
_i didn't have much inputintothe project (= the help i gave or work i did on it was small) .
_the power input will come largely from hydroelectricity.

children.name: user/computer user b1
children.definition: user/computer user/ˈjuːzəʳ, kəmˈpjuːtəʳ ˌjuːzəʳ/  someone who uses a computer:
examples: người dùng
▪ most computer users do not realize how much their computers can do.
▪ users often complain that the internet is slow and unreliable.
user-friendlyeasy to use
▪ the program is remarkably user-friendly and can be learned by anyone.

children.name: programmer c1
children.definition: programmer/computerprogrammer/ˈprəʊgræməʳ, kəmˌpjuːtəʳ ˈprəʊgræməʳ/  someone whose job is to write programs:
examples: lập trình viên
▪ computer programmers are in great demand, and a good one can earn a very high salary.
programmernoun[ c ] lập trình viên; thảo chương viên (alsocomputer programmer)
a person whose job is to produce computer programs

children.name: techie x
children.definition: techie/ˈteki/ informalsomeone who works in computing or who knows a lot about computers
examples: chuyên viên máy tính
: ▪ i don’t even bother trying to fix things that go wrong on my computer - i leave that to the techies.

children.name: hacker x
children.definition: hacker/ˈhækəʳ/  someone who secretly and often illegally gets into another person’s or company’s computer system:
examples: tin tặc
▪ hackers broke into the pentagon’s security system last night.
hackernoun[ c ] (alsocomputer hacker)
someone who hacks into other people's computer systems

children.name: software developer c1
children.definition: software developer/engineer/designer /ˈsɒftweəʳ dɪˌveləpəʳ, endʒˌnɪəʳ, dɪˌzaɪnəʳ/  someone whose job is to make software:
examples: người phát triển phần mềm
▪ software developers need to be aware that not all users are technical experts.

children.name: systems analyst x
children.definition: systems analyst /ˈsɪstəmz ˌænəlst/  someone whose job involves studying business or industrial systems, and who uses computers to plan improvements or changes:
examples: nhà phân tích hệ thống
▪ his first job as a systems analyst was to reorganize they way the store’s stock was recorded.

children.name: it support u
children.definition: it supportbritish/tech supportamerican /aɪ ˈtiː səˌpɔːʳt, ˈtek səˌpɔːʳt/  people whose job involves making sure that the computers in an organization are working properly:
examples: người hỗ trợ công nghệ thông tin
▪ if you’re not prepared to pay for adequate it support, it’s no wonder you lose so much time through computer problems.

children.name: things you do with a computer
enter b1
children.definition: enter/ˈentəʳ/  to put information into a computer by pressing the keys:
examples: nhập
▪ when you have entered your credit card information, go to the next screen.
enterverbinformation ghinhập
[ t ] to put information into a computer, book or document
_you have to enter apasswordto access the database.

children.name: scroll c2
children.definition: scroll/skrəʊl/  to move up or down through a document on a computer: scroll up/down
examples: cuộn lên xuống
▪ scroll down to see when the website was last updated.
scrollverb[ i usually + adv/prep ] làm hiện (văn bản) cuộn lên xuống (trên máy tính)
to move text or other information on a computer screen in order to view a different partof it
_scrolltothe end of the document.

children.name: search b1
children.definition: searchalsodoasearch/sɜːʳtʃ, ˌduː ɑ ˈsɜːʳtʃ/  to look for information on a computer or on the internet:
examples: tìm kiếm
search for
▪ i did a search for any articles by varenqe on the web, and i found quite a few.
search by
▪ to find a book on our site, you can search by author, title, or subject.
search something for something
▪ you can search the document for particular words or phrases, in order to get directly to the information you need.

children.name: highlight b2
children.definition: highlight/ˈhaɪlaɪt/  to mark words in a computer document in a different colour so that you can see them easily or to separate it from the rest of the document:
examples: đánh dấu
▪ to delete a block of text, highlight it and then press del.

children.name: hack into x
children.definition: hackinto/ˈhæk ɪntuː/  tosecretlyand oftenillegallyfind a way to reach the information on someone else’s computer system so that you can use, change, or damage it:
examples: đăng nhập không có sự cho phép
▪ a criminal gang hacked into a credit card company’s most secure files.
hackverbcomputing [ i usually + adverb or preposition ]
to get into someone else's computer systemwithout permission in order to find out information or do something illegal
_computerhacking has become very widespread over the last decade.
_a programmer had managed to hackintosome top-secret government data.

children.name: log on/log in/sign in b2
children.definition: log on/log in/sign in/ˌlɒg ˈɒnˌ, lɒg ˈɪn,ǁˌlɔːg-, ˌsaɪn ˈɪn/  to do the actions that will allow you to begin using a computer system, for example by typing a special word or giving a particular command:
examples: đăng nhập
▪ log on to our website and find out about the latest travel deals to the far east.
log in/onphrasal verb đăng nhập hệ thống
to connect a computer to a computer system by typing your name, so that you can startworking
_log on using your name and password.

children.name: log out/log off/sign out b2
children.definition: log out/log off/sign out/ˌlɒg ˈaʊtˌ, lɒg ˈɒf,ǁˌlɔːg-, ˌsaɪn ˈaʊt/  to do the actions you have to do when you finish using a computer system:
examples: đăng xuất
▪ when i logged off, the whole system froze up.
log off/outphrasal verb đăng xuất hệ thống
to stop a computer being connected to a computer system, usually when you want to stopworking
_could you all log off for a few minutes, please?

children.name: start up x
children.definition: start up /ˌstɑːʳt ˈʌp/  if you start up a computer, or it starts up, you turn it on:
examples: khởi động
▪ the anti-virus icon should appear whenever you start up your computer.

children.name: boot up x
children.definition: boot up/ˌbuːt ˈʌp/  if a computer boots up, it becomes ready to use by getting all the programs it needs into its memory. if you boot up a computer, you turn it on so that it is ready to use:
examples: khởi động
▪ just wait a couple of minutes while the computer boots up.
bootverbcomputer khởi động

[ i or t ] (alsoboot up)specializedwhen a computer boots (up), it becomes ready for use by getting the necessary information into its memory, and when you boot (up) a computer, you cause it to do this.

children.name: reboot x
children.definition: reboot/riːˈbuːt/  if you reboot a computer, or if it reboots, you make it turn itself off and then back on again, especially because it has not been working correctly:
examples: khởi động lại
▪ if a program crashes you usually have to reboot the computer.
rebootverb[ i or t ] khởi động lại; chạy lại
when a computer reboots, it switches off and then starts again immediately, and when you reboot a computer, you make it do this.

children.name: shut down b1
children.definition: shut down/ˌʃʌt ˈdaʊn/  if you shut a computer down or it shuts down, you turn it off:
examples: tắt máy
▪ i’m always forgetting to shut down my computer before i go home.

children.name: username x
children.definition: username/ˈjuːzəʳneɪm/  the name that you type into a computer, system, website etc. before typing your password:
examples: tài khoản
▪please enter your username and password.
usernamenoun[ c ] (alsouser id)
a name or other word that you sometimes need to type in together with apasswordbefore you are allowed to use a computer or the internet
_please enter your username and password.

children.name: password b1
children.definition: password/ˈpɑːswɜːʳdǁˈpæs-/  a series of secret letters or numbers that you must type into a computer before you can use a system or a program:
examples: ▪ don’t let anyone know your password.
passwordnoun[ c ] mật khẩu; mật lệnh
a secret word or combination of letters or numbers which is used for communicating with another person or with a computer to prove who you are
_i can't let you in unless yougivethe password.
_you can't gain access to the computer system withoutenteringyour password.

children.name: interactive b2
children.definition: interactive/ˌɪntərˈæktɪv◂/  interactive software allows the person using it to affect what happens on the computer screen:
examples: tương tác
▪ an interactive education package for 7-10-year-olds
▪ when designing your site, think about whether it needs to be interactive or informational.
interactiveadjective tương tácảnh hưởng lẫn nhau
describes a system or computer program which is designed to involve the user in the exchange of information
_an interactive game/video
_this is an interactive museum where children can actively manipulate the exhibits.

children.name: zoom in/out x
children.definition: zoom in/outphrasal verb
examples: to (cause a computer to) make the image of something or someone appear much larger and nearer, or much smaller and further away
_click on a photo of any student, and it zooms out to full-size.

children.name: access b2
children.definition: accessverbtruy cập
examples: to open a computerfile(= a collection of information stored on a computer) in order to look at or change information in it

children.name: format c1
children.definition: formatnoun cấu trúc của một đơn vị dữ liệu; dạng thức
examples: specializedthe way in which informationis arranged and stored on a computer

children.name: call sth up c2
children.definition: callsthupphrasal verb
examples: to find and show information on a computer screen
_you can use the search facility to call up all the occurrences of a particular word in a document.

children.name: unzip x
children.definition: unzipverb-pp- giảinén
examples: to return a computer file to its original size after it has beenzipped(= reduced in size so that it can be easily sent or stored)

children.name: overwrite x
children.definition: overwriteverboverwrote,overwrittenreplace viết đè lên, viết lên
examples: [ t ] if you overwrite a computer file, you replace it with a different one.

children.name: zip x
children.definition: zipverb-pp-computing nén(một tập tin)
examples: [ t ] tocompress(= reduce the size of) a computer file so that it uses less space, andcan be more easily sent or stored
_if you're desperate for disk space you could zip the file(up)and stick it on a floppy.
zip filenoun[ c ]tập tin nén
a computer file that has beencompressed(= reduced in size) so that it uses up less space

children.name: write x
children.definition: writeverbwrote,writtenorold usewrit viết
examples: [ i ]specializedto record information in the memory of a computer
_there was a problem writingtothe disk in the a drive.

children.name: to write sth on a computer, typewriter etc
type b1
children.definition: type/taɪp/  to write with a computer or a typewriter:
examples: đánh máy , gõ chữ
▪ i’m afraid i don’t type very fast.
▪ could you type those letters for me?
type something out/up : đánh máy ( từ một bản viết tay )
to type something that has been written on paper
▪ we’ll have someone type it out and put it in alphabetical order.
▪ i asked michelle to type up my assignment so i could mail it in today.
type in something : đánh vào, gõ vào ( chỗ trống )
type something in a blank space, for example on a form
▪ bring up the customer database, and type in the amount on the invoice.
typing [uncountable noun]: việc đánh máy, gõ chữ
writing with a typewriter or computer:
▪ marion says she’ll do some typing for us.
▪ we need a secretary with good typing speeds. who can type fast
typeverb[ i or t ]writeđánh máy
to write using a machine, either a computer keyboard or atypewriter
_she asked me to type a couple of letters.
_he can type very quickly.
_i was typingawayinto the early hours of the morning just to get the thing finished.

children.name: key in b2
children.definition: key in/ˌkiː ˈɪn/  especially british to write something on a computer, especially something that youarecopying:
examples: nhập vào
key in something
▪ i keyed in my password, but the file still won’t open.
key something in
▪ find out the name of the file, key it in, and it will appear on the screen
keysthinphrasal verb[ m ]
to put information into a computer or a machine using akeyboard

children.name: enter b1
children.definition: enter /ˈentəʳ/  to make words or numbers appear on a computer screen by pressing the keys:
examples: gõ vào, nhập vào
▪ enter the filename and click ‘ok’.
▪ she entered jim’s postcode, and watched as a street map appeared on the screen.
enter something in/into
▪ the patients’ medical records are entered into a database.
enterverbinformationghi (tên, chi tiết...) vào sổmáy tính; đăng ký; nhập
[ t ] to put information into a computer, book or document
_you have to enter apasswordto access the database.

children.name: write a1
children.definition: write/raɪt/  to write something using a computer:
examples: viết ( trên máy tính )
▪ most of our students write their essays on screen.
▪ while i was writing, the computer went down and i lost all my work.

children.name: print a2
children.definition: print/prɪnt/  to produce copies of a book, letter, newspaper etc using a printing machine:
examples: in
▪ most of our books are printed abroad.
▪ this book was printed on recycled paper.
▪ where did you get your wedding invitations printed?

children.name: print/print out x
children.definition: print/print out/prɪnt, ˌprɪnt ˈaʊt/  to produce a copy of something you have written on a computer using a special machine connected to it:
examples: in ra
▪ my printer prints out at 8 pages per minute.
▪ she printed three copies of the letter.

children.name: back up b2
children.definition: back up/ˌbæk ˈʌp/  to copy information from a computer onto a disk, so that it can be used if something goes wrong with the computer:
examples: sao chép dự trữ
back up something
sao chép dự trữ cái gì
▪ don’t forget to back up all the new files you create.
back something up
sao chép dự trữ cái gì
▪ i didn’t back the document up and lost the whole lot.
backsthupphrasal verb[ m often passive ]
to make an extra copy of computer information
_make sure you back up your files.

children.name: save a2
children.definition: save/seɪv/  to make a computer keep the work that you have done in its memory or on a disk:
examples: lưu
▪ save your work and close down any applications that are open.
save a photo
saveverbkeep
[ t ] to put information on a computer onto a computer disk

children.name: copy x
children.definition: copy/ˈkɒpiǁˈkɑː-/  to make a file, program etc that is exactly the same as another one:
examples: ▪ copy the files into a new folder.
sao chép

children.name: delete b1
children.definition: delete/dɪˈliːt/  to remove a piece of information from a computer’s memory:
examples: xóa
▪ delete any files that end in ‘.tmp’.
delete a photo

children.name: cut and paste x
children.definition: cutandpaste/ˌkʌt ən ˈpeɪst/  to remove a piece of information from one place in a computer program or document and put it in a different place instead:
examples: di chuyển, cắt và dán
▪ it’s easier if you just cut and paste the information from one page to another.
cut and paste
to move words or pictures from one place to another in a computer document

children.name: select b1
children.definition: select/sɪˈlekt/  to use the mouse to choose words or pictures on a computer screen, usually making them change colour:
examples: chọn
▪ to create parallel columns, press alt-f7 and select option 4.

children.name: copy and paste x
children.definition: copy and paste
examples: if you copy and paste something on a computer screen, you move it from one area toanother

children.name: paste x
children.definition: pasteverbcomputing
examples: [ i or t ] to move a piece of text to a particular place in a computer document
_cut that paragraph and then paste it at the end of the page.

children.name: open b1
children.definition: open/ˈəʊpən/  to make a document or computer program ready to use :
examples: mở
▪ open the file called templates.
open
openverbcomputer
[ t ] if you open a computer document or program, you make it ready to read or use
_to open a new document, click 'file', then click 'new'.
_click the desktop icon to open thecambridgeadvanced learner's dictionary.

children.name: close a1
children.definition: close/kləʊz/  to do the things you have to do when you want to stop using a document or a computer program:
examples: đóng
▪ close all applications before shutting down your computer.

children.name: escape x
children.definition: escapeverbcomputer thoát chương trình
examples: [ i ]specializedto press the key on a computer keyboard which allows you to leave a particular screen and return to the previous one or to interrupt a process
_escapefromthis window and return to the main menu.

children.name: exit b1
children.definition: exitverbcomputer thoát chương trình
examples: to end a computer program that you are using
_you have to exit the program before starting another.

children.name: import x
children.definition: importverb
examples: [specialized] to copy information from one computer or computer program to another
i need to import data from the database into my word processor.
imported files
import a photo
once you import your photo , you can select, preview and adjust one of almost two hundred special effect filters to apply to your photo.
fromwindows 2000 to windows 7 you should be able togetyourphotos imported.

children.name: export x
children.definition: exportverb thay đổi định dạng của dữliệu
examples: [ t ] if you export information from a computer, you copy a large amount of it either toa different part of the computer's storage space or to another form of storage such as afloppydisk, so that it can be used for a different purpose.

children.name: install x
children.definition: install,uk alsoinstalverbready to use cài (phần mềm)
examples: specializedto put a computer program onto a computer so that the computer can use it
_andrew, can you help me install this software?

children.name: uninstall x
children.definition: uninstallverb tháo cài đặt; gỡ bỏ chương trình phần mềm ra khỏi máy vi tính
examples: to remove a computer program from a computer
_the program ran so slowly, i had to uninstall it.
_to uninstall this demo, double-click the add/remove icon.

children.name: left click
children.definition: verb
examples: to press the button on the left of a computermousein order to make the computer do something

children.name: right click
children.definition: verb
examples: to press the button on the right of a computermousein order to make the computer do something
_right click on the start button and then click on 'explore'.

children.name: click on a2
children.definition: clickon/ˈklɪk ɒn/  to press a button on a mouse in order to choose something on the screen and make the computer perform a particular action:
examples: nhấp vào
▪ click on ‘next’ when you have finished filling out the form.
clickverboperate computer
[ i or t ]specializedto (cause a computer instruction to) operate by pressing a button on themouse(= small control device) of a computer
_if you want to open a file, click twiceonthe icon for it.
_when you have selected the file you want, click the 'open' box.
clicka2noun[ c ]computer operation
when you press a button on themouse(= small control device) of a computer to operate it

children.name: drag b1
children.definition: drag/dræg/  to move something on a computer screen by pulling it along with the mouse:
examples: kéo chuột
▪ you can delete the files by dragging them into your ‘trash’ folder.
dragverb-gg-pull kéo lê
[ t ] to move something on a computer screen using amouse(device)

children.name: drag and drop b1
children.definition: drag and drop kéo và thả
examples: if you drag and drop something on a computer screen, you move it from one area toanother using themouse(device).

children.name: edit b2
children.definition: editverb
examples: to prepare a photo or video for printing or viewing by correcting mistakes and deciding what will be removed and what will be kept in, etc
edit a photo
we generally just use photoshop for editing our photos and related graphics, and use them in dreamweaver.
this is one of myedited photos

certainly, if you're a digital artist, editingphotos or video, then the more accurate panel could help you unlock extra details from your graphics, but the rest of us simply get richer colors and much better contrast.
editing[ u ]
filming the documentary took two months, but editing took another four.
photoeditting
i recommend using digital photos and doing the measurements by pixel within a photo editing program.

children.name: attach b1
children.definition: to attacha photo
examples: they canattacha photo too, if they want to be more easily identified
please seeattached photosand video link below

children.name: enlarge x
children.definition: enlarge to make something appear larger on screen.
examples: phóng to
enlarge a photo
do you have any problems enlarging the photos to see them better?
pleaseseeenlargedphoto
if you enlarge the photos by clicking on them you will see that they do appear to be round.

children.name: store b2
children.definition: store a photo
examples: i store photos on an external hard drive.
do you use dropbox to store photos or documents?
access stored photos , videos and documents both at home and when you are away.
photos.app stores yourphotos and allows some level of editing.
see how many students currently store photos online.

children.name: recover b1
children.definition: recover a photo
examples: the software recovers photo lost due to hardware-software malfunctioning.

children.name: transfer b1
children.definition: transfer
examples: to move files from one device to another :
transfer a photo
transfer photos between android and computer.
we recommend art's camera as a place where you can get photos transferredto a cd, or copied.

children.name: convert b2
children.definition: convert
examples: to change one file format to another.
convert sth to / into sth
convert a photo
slide show is an easy-to-use tool to convert digital photos to video

children.name: sync x
children.definition: sync( alsosynch) / sɪŋk /
examples: to connect two electronic devices so that they both have the latest information or files:
from sth to sth
how do i sync my iphone to my computer?
sync a photo
i synced my photos from my iphone to my macbook.

children.name: share u
children.definition: shareto post or repost (something) on a social media website or application.
examples: the app lets you share your photos on facebook, twitter, and tumblr
share a photo
thanks for sharing the photos from naspa!
the review can be read from the photo shared.
sharing[ u ]
photo sharing
instagram is a very popular photosharing app.
